about_the_game:
A STUDENT-LED NARRATIVE GAME

A student-led project turned indie game debut from Last Praetorian Interactive. Forge your own path in this exciting branching narrative experience. Featuring incredible lifelike performances, rich world-building, and tense action sequences, Project Vesperi is designed as a short impactful narrative built from the ground up to be replayable. Play again and again to discover entirely different conclusions based on the decisions you make throughout the story.

FORGE YOUR OWN PATH

Every choice, no matter how small, affects the ending. Exploring the world can unearth new narrative moments.

DOCTOR EVELYN ROTH

You are Doctor Evelyn Roth, a U.N.E. astrobiologist dedicated to searching for potential signs of life across our solar system. When an anomaly is found on Venus, she must decide how far she’ll go to secure it when an intruder emerges, risking her life and the fate of everyone in the station.

THEIR FATE IS IN YOUR HANDS

Each character can live or die, depending on your choices.

JESSE HARTWELL

Young and naive, rookie Venus researcher Jesse Hartwell discovers the anomaly, hopeful that he’s found a sign of life.

HELEN WARD

A natural skeptic, Helen Ward is the grizzled senior researcher on Venus who doubts the potential of the anomaly.

THE COLONEL

Cutthroat and driven, The Colonel is an unknown agent intent on seizing the anomaly from Evelyn and the researchers.

THE SEARCH FOR WHO WE ARE

The year is 2083. Earth’s natural resources have dwindled. The Unified Nations of Earth have made major strides to find the future of our species' survival, but it's clear that Earth is beyond saving. After previously ignoring the crisis, the United Colonies of America have now started a program to colonize the solar system, determined to do whatever necessary to overtake the U.N.E.'s lead in the new space race.

Enter this turbulent near future and determine the fate of humanity with your choices on Venus in Project Vesperi. Play the demo today and get a glimpse into a larger narrative gameplay experience to come from Last Praetorian Interactive.

Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 Home
  • Processor: Intel i5 8400 2.80 GHz
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 3GB

  • Storage: 10 GB available space

Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: Project Vesperi is a student-led branching narrative sci-fi game where you play as Dr. Evelyn Roth, sent to investigate a potential sign of life on Venus. When an intruder threatens the only habitable station on the planet, your choices will shape the fate of those around you—and humanity itself.
